org.itemscript.core.values
Interface JsonItem

All Superinterfaces:
HasSystem, JsonGetAccess, JsonPutAccess
All Known Implementing Classes:
ItemscriptItem
public interface JsonItem
extends HasSystem, JsonGetAccess, JsonPutAccess

A JsonItem is associated with a JsonValue loaded from a particular source. It provides methods for accessing values nested inside its associated JsonValue by fragment identifier, for accessing values relative to the URL that this item was originally loaded from, and for adding event handlers that will be notified when values inside this item are modified or removed.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

Method Detail

addHandler

HandlerReg addHandler(Handler handler)
Add an event handler to this item. The handler will be called any time the value of this item changes or is removed. The returned HandlerReg can be used to remove the event handler at a later date.

Parameters:
handler - The Handler to attach to this JsonItem.
Returns:
The HandlerReg for this event handler.

get

JsonValue get(java.lang.String url)
Get a value from (or relative to) this item by URL. If the URL is a fragment only (starting with "#"), the fragment will be used to retrieve a value from the root value of this item. A fragment of "#" will return the root value; a fragment containing a string will be split on the dot (".") character, and each component will be URL-unencoded, then the components will be used to navigate from the root value of this item to the desired child item. If the URL is a relative URL (starting with a path or a query), it will be interpreted as relative to the source URL of this item and then retrieved with JsonSystem.get(String). If the URL is an absolute URL, it will be retrieved with JsonSystem.get(String).

Parameters:
url - The URL to get.
Returns:
The value returned by the get operation.

get

void get(java.lang.String url,
         GetCallback callback)
Get a value from (or relative to) this item by URL, asynchronously. The URL will be interpreted the same way as in get(String). The supplied callback will be called when the value is returned.

Parameters:
url - The URL to get.
callback - The callback that will be called when the get operation completes.

meta

JsonObject meta()
Retrieve optional metadata about this item.

Returns:
A JsonObject containing metadata about this item, or null if no metadata is available.

put

PutResponse put(java.lang.String url,
                JsonValue value)
Put a value in (or relative to) this item by URL. The URL will be interpreted the same way as in get(String).

Parameters:
url - The URL to put the value at.
value - The value to put.
Returns:
The PutResponse returned by the put operation.

put

void put(java.lang.String url,
         JsonValue value,
         PutCallback callback)
Put a value in (or relative to) this item by URL, asynchronously. The URL will be interpreted the same way as in get(String). The supplied callback will be called when the operation is complete.

Parameters:
url - The URL to put the value at.
value - The value to put.
callback - The callback that will be called when the put operation completes.

remove

RemoveResponse remove(java.lang.String url)
Remove a value from (or relative to) this item by URL. The URL will be interpreted the same way as in get(String).

Parameters:
url - The URL to remove a value from.
Returns:
The RemoveResponse returned by the remove operation.

remove

void remove(java.lang.String url,
            RemoveCallback callback)
Remove a value from (or relative to) this item by URL. The URL will be interpreted the same way as in get(String). The supplied callback will be called when the operation is complete.

Parameters:
url - The URL to remove a value from.
callback - The callback to call when the remove operation completes.

removeHandler

void removeHandler(HandlerReg reg)
Remove an event handler from this item. Use this to clean up event handlers when the object they point to needs to be garbage-collected; otherwise, they will leak memory.

Parameters:
reg - The original HandlerReg that was returned from addHandler.

detachValue

void detachValue()
Detach the value from this item, allowing it to be attached to a different item.

source

java.lang.String source()
Get the source URL of this item.

Returns:
The source URL of this item.

value

JsonValue value()
Get the JsonValue of this item.

Returns:
The JsonValue of this item.
